summary: The Jumpstart on College Act aims to increase the number of students completing postsecondary credentials. It authorizes appropriations for grants to support early college high schools and dual/concurrent enrollment programs. Funds are allocated to eligible entities (partnerships between higher education and local educational agencies) and States, with a portion reserved for national activities. Grants support activities like curriculum development, student support services, and outreach. The bill emphasizes serving underrepresented students and requires reporting on program outcomes, with a national evaluation also mandated.
